clinical_study.brief_title: Frailty and Postoperative Outcomes After Emergency General Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Frailty and Postoperative Outcomes After Emergency General Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will examine the association between preoperative frailty and postoperative outcomes and resource utilization after emergency general surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Mortality events will be identified from the registered person's database in Ontario from the date of surgery to 365 days after surgery, at which time participants will be censored

secondary_outcome.time_frame: day of surgery to 365 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days in hospital from date of surgery to 365 days after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from date of surgery to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of a special care unit admission from the Discharge abstract database from the date of surgery to 30 days after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Date of surgery to hospital discharge or 365 days after surgery (at which time participants will be censored)
secondary_outcome.description: Discharge disposition to an institution in the discharge abstract database

secondary_outcome.time_frame: day of surgery to 365 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Total costs incurred by the provincial health care system from the day of surgery to 365 days after surgery

arm_group.description: All patients having emergency general surgery procedures as defined by Scott et al (JAMA Surgery 2016)

intervention.description: Participants will be defined as frail based on the Johns Hopkins ACG Frailty Defining Diagnoses Indicator, which will be applied to available health administrative data in the 3 years preceding index hospital admission. If no frailty defining diagnoses are present participants will be defined as not frail

study_pop.textblock: All adult residents of Ontario with valid provincial health insurance who have an emergency general surgery procedure (large bowel surgery, small bowel surgery, cholecystectomy, control of hemorrhage from duodenal ulcer, lysis of adhesions, appendectomy, laparotomy)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All residents of Ontario aged more than 65 years on their surgery date with valid provincial health insurance who have an emergency general surgery procedure (large bowel surgery, small bowel surgery, cholecystectomy, control of hemorrhage from duodenal ulcer, lysis of adhesions, appendectomy, laparotomy)
Exclusion Criteria:
- No valid provincial health insurance
